programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: After a car mounts the pavement, pedestrians with serious injuries are brought into AandE. Jodies cut her leg on glass on a night out. And is 61-year-old Crispin having a stroke?

programme.title: Mitchell and Webb Are Not Helping
programme.desc: The real cause of climate change? Its good news and bad news. Plus: TVs most wholesome heirloom repair show. A death in the Sweary Aussie family. And the lawyers intervene in the writers room.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole, Simon OBrien and Max McMurdo travel across the UK to find unique items lost in peoples homes to fix up for a profit. This episode features part of a tornado jet.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Theres delicate demolition at Jonas and Ulrikes village, as a dilapidated church organ gets a makeover. And strict Brexit rules threaten to derail Kates Bulgarian dream.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A desert storm blows in weather woes for two guesthouse owners in Spain. In Greece two dive instructors try to end their season on a high. And will a vineyard in Italy bear fruit?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Rachael and Tim cant agree on whether to stay in their 1930s semi, or move somewhere more rural to bring up their two young children. Rachael longs for leafier pastures, but Tim would rather stay closer to his nearby friends and family.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Corfu holds a special place in Lisa and Waynes hearts, as its where they just got married. Can Laura Hamilton find them the perfect holiday home in Kassiopi for their £130k?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sallys after a family holiday home in Manilva, Spain for £190k. Craig Rowe shows her a quirky townhouse and a place with a tantalising terrace, but did one impress her in La Duquesa?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: First to host in North Devon is eco campaigner Hector Christie, whos hoping to wow everyone with a selection of raw food delights and home grown produce. However, the guests are more amazed by Tapeley Park, the stately home he lives in!

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its day two in North Devon and the turn of former cabaret queen and make-up artist Kirsten Brend to impress her guests. Kirsten hosts a Danish themed night, showcasing her roots.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Third to host in North Devon is 39 year old slate salesman Damion Fearnley. Damion is aiming to impress his guests with a carefully crafted menu of restaurant quality food.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In North Devon, its the turn of theatre nurse Jenny Fox to host. Shes hoping to execute her evening with medical precision, but it doesnt get off to the best start.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night in North Devon sees retired housekeeper Viv Foster on hosting duty. Shes feeling confident about her posh dinner party after years of experience serving the rich and famous.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Martial arts expert Dan hosts the weeks final visit in Southport, where he aims to please with his no-nonsense approach to a classic seaside getaway. The bed and breakfast owners seem less positive about some cleanliness issues.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie catches up with Catherine and Nigel, who were at a loss over what to do with their home in Larne, Northern Ireland. Catherine wanted out of their three-bed bungalow, while Nigel had fallen in love with their big garden and stunning views.

programme.title: Great British Train Journeys From Above
programme.desc: In Scotland, the Jacobite Steam Train, better known as the Hogwarts Express, travels across the Scottish Highlands, unlocking the fascinating history of the Jacobite Rebellion.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: We catch up with Becky and Adam in Essex, whose dreamy doer-upper has changed a lot since 2019, and Kinga and Dave, who loved and lost out in Leeds before finding the one in 2021.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: In an egg-ception Bake Off first, its Meringue Week, and the bakers whisk up tarts, souffles and ice cream cake. Who can keep their cool and whose souffle will be in disarray?

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: Fourteen civilians become fugitives, attempting a daring escape from Stansted Airport to win a share of £100,000. They must evade Chief Ray Howard and his crack team of hunters for 21 days.

programme.title: Hunted

programme.title: Social Media Monsters

programme.title: Operation Daybreak
programme.desc: In 1942 Czechoslovakia, SS-General Reinhard Heydrich is appointed to become the Reich Protector of Bohemia and Moravia. The terror and oppression that follow cause Allied authorities in London to authorise a secret mission to kill the man who has come to be known as `The Butcher of Prague. The film explores shows the operation leading up to Heydrichs death as well as the massive German reprisals that followed it.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Welcome to the Penguin Post Office, a little bit of Britain in the heart of Antarctica. Inside, the post office has everything youd expect. Outside, things are a little bit different. Neighbouring the post office are 3,000 gentoo penguins. They are there to raise a family but their lives are far from picture postcard as adultery and robbery are rife.

programme.title: Angela Lansbury at the NFT
programme.desc: In a programme first broadcast in 1973, actress Angela Lansbury talks to American columnist Rex Reed and answers questions from members of the audience at Londons National Film Theatre. Featuring extracts from her films, including The Picture of Dorian Gray, The Harvey Girls, Dark at the Top of the Stairs, The Manchurian Candidate and Black Flowers for the Bride.

programme.title: Mercury Prize

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: Stephen Smith, explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici. Cosimos fledgling court prized the finer things in life and some of the greatest painters, sculptors and craftsmen in world history came to serve the Grand Duke. However, successful courtiers had to have brains as well as brawn. The canniest of them looked to theorists like Niccolo Machiavelli for underhand ways to get ahead, whilst enlightened polymaths turned their minds to the heavens, and to ice cream.

programme.title: Angela Lansbury at the NFT

programme.desc: Simon uncovers the truth about Spains hero El Cid. He also investigates the horror of the Spanish Inquisition and in the process discovers an unsettling story about one of his own ancestors.

programme.desc: Tommy is in Rugeley in Staffordshire to see a three-bed mid-terrace bought by a trio of experienced developers. Jacqui is in north west London to see two flats that may be better reverting back to one.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

Ginny also discovers a beautiful green space on the outskirts of Kettering, where the towns residents can recharge their minds, bodies and green fingers.

programme.desc: Last year, a teenager suffered lifelong injuries after being hit by a speeding car. Who was the driver? And Police Scotland smash a grooming gang.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The new owner of a terrace in Crewe isnt put off by the numerous safety bolts on the front door. The seasoned developer turns it into a smart HMO (house in multiple occupation), while a father-and-daughter team modernise a semi in Doncaster. A former estate agent takes two years to extend and transform a Gravesend house into a smart, boutique-style HMO.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The hills of Carmarthenshire are the setting for a shopping showdown between two teams of bargain hunters, while Roo Irvine learnes about the centuries-old craft of making chain mail.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Things take a horrible turn when one of the lead actors of a local amateur theatre show is murdered by one of the other performers.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is on home ground in the Welsh Borders as he showcases some tempting houses to a retired couple who have a whopping £1 million to spend. Along with a characterful property, theyre after somewhere with holiday-let potential or space for a glamping business. Jules is also in his element when he meets experts in traditional construction methods who are keeping heritage building skills alive.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team joins forces to revive a suit of armour that belonged to actor Joss Ackland. And the restoration of a pair of line dancing boots sees the experts rhythm put to the test.

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz, packed with strategy, high stakes and surprises, where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret stash of cash - anything between zero and a whopping £4,000.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the brainy quiz where the contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.

programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: Policing Paradise
programme.desc: Bermudas natural beauty is renowned around the world, and nowhere illustrates this more than Coopers Island Nature Reserve on the south east tip of the island. On duty in this ecological oasis are officers Eddie Smith and Jen Ysseldyke, but during patrol they discover a car illegally parked inside this protected area. The officers eventually find the culprit, but in the process discover Officer Smith has accidentally locked the gate to the nature reserve, leaving everyone trapped inside.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Rafi was left with brain damage after falling seriously ill. Now he is home after a year in hospital, but his house isnt suitable - the family needs the teams help.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is host, with guest panellists comedian Ross Noble and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: Hosting Saudi Radio alone in a Norwich business park prompts Alan to ask the question: is solitude healthy, or do we need other people? Can dogs or technology fill the void?

programme.title: Reporting Scotland
programme.desc: The latest news and weather from around Scotland.

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Following four families as they compete in Scotlands haggis contest. All hail from small butcher shops and each has ambitions of winning the World Haggis Championships in Perth. We meet the butchers, see life on farms, and learn how haggis is made.

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian and Major head to the once-popular seaside resort of Girvan in Ayrshire. Ian has many happy memories of going there as a child and wants to find out how much it has changed. From the more traditional fun of the boating lake and the games arcade, to newer aspects of the town like accessible bicycles and bubble football, there is something for everyone.

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie is near Aberfeldy in Perthshire investigating how climate change is causing an increase in tick-borne diseases. Meanwhile, Anne is on the Isle of Mull bringing in the oyster harvest.

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: On the Isle of Lewis, police hunt for suspected salmon poachers. In Glencoe, PC Stephen Cooper pursues a missing person case, and in Inverness, cops conduct drug raids in the city.

programme.title: Limmys Show
programme.desc: Limmy gets a new girlfriend, caustic Jacqueline McCafferty goes shopping, and call-in show host Falconhoof has trouble with a difficult caller.

programme.title: Burnistoun
programme.desc: Popping into a trendy coffee shop that has an original way of serving a cappuccino, the proprietor of a business specialising in wooden pallets gives us his idea of a sophisticated sales pitch in a specially made TV advert, and a high street boutique delivers questionable sartorial advice to a confused punter.

programme.title: Scotcast
programme.desc: Conversation about Scotlands biggest news stories, hosted by Martin Geissler.

programme.title: Scot Squad
programme.desc: Traffic officers Singh and McKirdy escort a very special delivery as they do their part to save a species from extinction. Meanwhile, rural officers McIntosh and Mackay find themselves in a seemingly endless search in the house of a hoarder, and the chief explores the possibility of swapping Stop and Search for Pop and Lock as he learns some street dance.

programme.title: Still Game

programme.title: Breaking the News
programme.desc: Join Des Clarke and his special guests Susie McCabe, Amanda Dwyer and Liam Withnail as they break down the weeks news and put it back together again. They look at everything from Holyrood to Hollywood and bring you the humour behind the headlines.

programme.title: Growing Up Scottish
programme.desc: Wendy Wason, Chris MacArthur-Boyd, Jamie McDonald, Ashley Storrie and Janey Godley, amongst others, remember Family Life; dinner time, family phrases and getting told off.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: There is much more to Florence Nightingale than being `The Lady with the Lamp. Follow Florence as she embarks on her journey to help the soldiers in the Crimean War, and in doing so changes the world of nursing forever.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Hoping for a chance at a cash prize for their chosen charities are comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean, rapper Lady Leshurr, actor Shane Richie, opera singer Russell Watson, The Repair Shops Will Kirk and comedian Shazia Mirza.

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Friends Astrid and Rob from Brighton, sisters Jay and Abi from London, and couple Debs and Hong from North Yorkshire compete for the jackpot.

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul makes the trip across the pond in search of the queen with the most charisma, uniqueness, nerve and talent in the United Kingdom, setting the contestants a series of challenges week by week.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared. Are they ready to re-ignite their love, or is it one final near miss?

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit on `Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows it is his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. If the day goes well, it could catapult his career, but if it goes badly, it is game over.

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena must ask Simon for a favour, but at a price. With his dream within reach, Kwabena has big choices to make.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Fresh new talent aim to impress famous faces and follow in the footsteps of some of stand-ups biggest names. Across a number of rounds, comedians compete to show they could be the next breakout comedy star.

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evies still reeling from the message she saw on Noas phone. But when the two are left alone together, something extraordinary happens. Is it the start of a new journey for Evie?

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: While Evie throws herself headlong at life, Suz and Josh worry its too much, too soon. Meanwhile, Noa realises he has to face up to his feelings...

programme.title: BBC Comedy Singles
programme.desc: Chloe, Jack and David are navigating life at Kirkmoore, a residential college for disabled students. Jack is girl-obsessed and determined to get a reluctant David, who just wants to knuckle down and finish his essay, on a night out. Meanwhile, Chloe has an online date shes anxious to go well. As the evening unfolds in less than ideal circumstances for the trio, we see the reality of how life outside the college affects them.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Emotions are running high during a house hunt in Herefordshire, where Sonali Shah is helping a couple to make a fresh start in the countryside after a life-changing event.

programme.title: Marcus Wareings Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: Marcus plans to bring in some ducks, but things arent as simple as they seem as he heads out onto the lake to create a new home for them. Heading to Devon, he discovers the perfect breed for the smallholding and picks up some top tips and tricks on how to rear them.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Amy Murray is joined by Punk Chef, aka Scott Garthwaite to discuss food and peoples relationship with it.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the quiz show where players face a question and pick from a board of six rankable answers. Some answers are good, but only one is unbeatable.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: North West England: Starters and Fish
programme.desc: Four chefs compete for north west England with canapes, starters and fish dishes inspired by great Britons of the past. Who will be eliminated?

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: Scalloper Golden Promise is pushing force-6 winds to get to newly opening scallops beds ahead of his rivals. With the boat first to the grounds, they are in for a big pay day - but only once they cover the £8,000 fuel expenses to get here. Family-owned trawler Adenia leaves Lerwick aiming to land 1,000 tonnes of mackerel in Norway in just three days time.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Members of the public try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Una Healy, Joanna Page, Jack P Shepherd and Emmanuel Sonubi test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Janette Manrara serves up more backstage gossip and behind-the-scenes action from the world of Strictly. Also, Strictlys costume designer Vicky Gill returns to showcase what some of the couples are wearing at the weekend.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Two northern entertainers go head-to-head as actor and comedian Crissy Rock faces personality, presenter and good pal Scarlett Moffatt. Giving the celebs a helping hand are antique pros Margie Cooper and Christina Trevanion.

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: On the Isle of Lewis, police hunt for suspected salmon poachers. In Glencoe, PC Stephen Cooper pursues a missing person case, and in Inverness, cops conduct drug raids in the city.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.sub-title: Saving Lives at Sea in World War II
programme.desc: In this special episode commemorating the 2024 bicentenary of the RNLI, Dermot OLeary will uncover the untold story of the institutions heroic efforts in the Second World War.

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by the latest banished and murdered celebrity Players as theyre told the identity of the Traitors for the very first time...

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Ordinary Love
programme.desc: Joan and Tom have been married for many years. There is an ease to their relationship that only comes from spending a life time together and a depth of love which expresses itself through tenderness and humour in equal part. When Joan is unexpectedly diagnosed with breast cancer, the course of her treatment shines a light on their relationship as they are faced with the challenges that lie ahead and the prospect of what might happen if something were to happen to her.

programme.title: Dragons Den
programme.desc: A prehistoric pitch for educational dinosaurs, business partners with nutritional yeast, an outdoor fitness venture and an app to empower women returning to work.

programme.desc: Continuing his quest to fix the nations mind, Alan posits a question - does talking help or is it better to just shut your mouth? - and uses it to help the meek speak.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain
programme.desc: From playing computer games with chimpanzees to studying modern relationships, Jim Al-Khalili investigates how the brain evolved and how they differ from AI.

programme.title: Cracking the Case
programme.sub-title: The Heist, the Hit and the Hunt
programme.desc: A series of seemingly unrelated events reveals a web of organised crime. How did an iPad found in the River Thames link a UK murder plot with a heist from a Swiss museum?

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: The shocking testimony of a man accused of murdering his wife; a defence attorney receives the worst birthday present of his life in court; a defendant attempts a daring courthouse escape.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: A murder trial descends into chaos and confusion; an aspiring country singer gets stage fright in bond court; a career criminal attempts to teach a fellow defendant a life lesson.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les is furious to learn that dealers are poaching his customers, and things get worse when he informs a client that the bling on their diamond watch is bogus.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is in Liverpools Anglican Cathedral to celebrate the 1.5 million pounds the public have taken in cash since the antiques show began, he recalls some of the best auction results, biggest bargains and the boldest sellers ever to visit the Dealers Den.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: Today Matlock in Derbyshire plays host to David Dickinson and his team, where Brenda Haller has her work cut out with a seller whos brought in a silver water jug, Tony Geering tries his best to buy an Aspreys powder compact and one seller drives a hard bargain for her Moroccan watercolour.

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole and his partners Allen Millyard and Guy Willison are back on the road trawling Britains sheds and auction houses for rusty relics to restore and sell on for a tidy profit - this time they delve into the many sheds of bike specialist Yeomans of Bromsgrove looking for a vintage British sled, take a 1200-pound punt on the contents of a van owned by top dealer Doug, and try to turn a profit at the Stratford Racecourse auto jumble.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton head to a live auction in Mission Hills, California. They uncover an unusual Marilyn Monroe statue, an industrial slip nslide, and a bed of nails.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Recently separated, Brandi and Jarrod find themselves at the same auction, and tensions flare. So much so, that she gets the Laura treatment, and he regresses to his childhood self.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello cant wait to see what he can drum up this time around. Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it. Kenny does his best to fire up his profits.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Security catch a burglar in the parking lot but when they drag her inside, the Golds are hit with a huge surprise.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les takes a customers word on an item and forks out wads of cash to make it his. Later, Ashley makes a discovery that leaves him looking like a fool.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les demands blood after a member of Seths team makes a colossal mistake. Unwilling to turn the culprit over, Seth is forced to take a stand against his enraged father.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Researchers study a comet explosion 13,000 years ago that ignited a firestorm across much of North America and killed nearly every living thing, including the Clovis human culture.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The team is astonished when Gary unearths multiple artefacts in close proximity to the old ships wharf and with the discovery of a shallower tunnel in the Money Pit, Martys theory of an off-set chamber may finally be proven.

programme.title: What on Earth?
programme.desc: How the Eye of the Sahara, a beautiful 25 mile structure, is formed remains a mystery; incredible clouds emanating from an island in the Indian Ocean could be evidence of a terrifying new weather weapon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey race to San Diego to take a spin in the classic car Hells Chariot, from the movie "Grease"; Chum takes a whack at a Punch-A-Bag game once played by Jack Dempsey.

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly
programme.desc: This time they head down to Dorset to meet Tim, the owner of a delectable collection of trinkets, and come away with some choice items to bulk up their stock - they then return to the Ledbury auctions for yet more items before heading down the road to the Cotswold Oil Engine and Preservation Societys famous bring and buy sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Santa Ana, Dan and Laura hope for better units and better buyers. Rene tries to capitalise on warehouse sales and scoots away with a deal. Jarrod finally buys the locker he wants; Darrell reflects on what it means to buy lockers full of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Back in Montebello, Brandi and her buddy set the wayback machine and discover a roaring good time. Darrell makes the most of the little hes got. And Kenny fills his piggy bank, while courting an unfamiliar pastime.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Ancient Aliens on Location: The UFO Investigations
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos takes a look back at the most compelling investigations of all, and events that he believes represent real encounters with extraterrestrial visitors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Discussing whether ancient cultures could have encountered extraterrestrial beings that have achieved eternal life, and discussing the Ancient Astronaut Theorists suggestions.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Evidence suggests contact with interstellar travellers in the distant past may have influenced humankind and many of its sacred sites.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Recently separated, Brandi and Jarrod find themselves at the same auction, and tensions flare. So much so, that she gets the Laura treatment, and he regresses to his childhood self.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello cant wait to see what he can drum up this time around. Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it. Kenny does his best to fire up his profits.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal
programme.desc: Stockport plays host to David and his team of dealers, where David Hakeneys eyes light up for a bizarre antique lamp, Simon Schneider forecasts a battle over a barometer and Brenda Haller gets a big kick out of a rare 1920s football programme.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: For more than four decades, award-winning journalist Linda Moulton Howe has covered the most mysterious phenomena on Earth.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.sub-title: Swamp Beast Sighting, Martian Conspiracy, and Transparent Mexican Sea Monster
programme.desc: Did a canoer capture footage of the legendary Bigfoot-like Skunk Ape? What is the mysterious, transparent creature dubbed the `Sea Monster recently discovered in Mexico? Tony Harris and his team delve into these claims to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Encounter: UFO
programme.desc: Being on an aircraft that comes in close proximity to an object that doesnt appear on radar is a scary experience. Who are they and what do they want?

programme.title: Curse of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While shocking events take place in the same location where the team has witnessed UAPs fly in and out of the Mesa, a cow is found to have died under very disturbing circumstances.

programme.title: UFOs: The Lost Evidence
programme.desc: Although alien abduction claims are often dismissed as hoaxes or delusions, there are landmark cases that scholars struggle to refute. Calvin Parker retells his harrowing experience of being abducted near the Pascagoula River in Mississippi.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A mysterious mountain in northern Italy has stood witness to strange sightings in the sky and unexplainable phenomena for hundreds of years.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Court Cam

programme.sub-title: The One With the Memorial Service
programme.desc: When Chandler jokingly posts an outrageous biography about Ross on Ross college alumni website, Ross retaliates in kind, sparking an internet war. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Hoping to win a huge jackpot, the friends pool their money and buy dozens of lottery tickets, but they argue over how to spend the fortune if they win, and Monica irritates everyone else by buying tickets just for her and Chandler. Exasperated, Phoebe takes the bowl of everyones tickets and threatens to throw it off the balcony. The others make up, but a pigeon startles Phoebe.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: A visit to the set of a soap opera inspires Rachel to dream of a romantic encounter with Joey, and Chandler must take Ross on a weekend getaway after Monica is unable to take time off from work.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Soap Opera Party
programme.desc: Ross is excited when he meets a stunning palaeontology professor, but when he takes her to Joeys rooftop party for the actors soap-opera co-stars, she intimidates him with her impressive list of former boyfriends. Meanwhile, Rachel and an intoxicated Monica make fools of themselves at the party chasing after the hunky daytime actors.

programme.title: Criminally Funny
programme.desc: Strap yourselves in for some calamitous crime and ludicrous law enforcement!

programme.desc: Moronic misdemeanors including petrol station pillocks, a buffoon on a bridge, and bad bears.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys, posing as waiters, offer ridiculous specials to customers, and team up at a house-keeping job, doing and saying whatever the other guys tell them.

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys volunteer to take ridiculous notes to a focus group, and they try to get a bystander to back up their story to a store manager after falling into a tower of cereal boxes.

programme.sub-title: The One Where Old Yeller Dies

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica decides to hold a surprise birthday for Rachel, but everything goes wrong when Rachels estranged parents turn up unexpectedly. The party then splits into two factions: a dreary gathering in Monicas apartment, and a college-style drunken party at Chandler and Joeys flat.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Chicken Pox

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Barry and Mindys Wedding
programme.desc: When Rachel serves as a bridesmaid at the wedding of her ex-fiance Barry and her friend Mindy, she relives the nightmare of her own failed wedding day. Meanwhile, Chandler becomes enamoured with a woman he meets on the internet, but is surprised when he finally meets her.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Princess Leia Fantasy
programme.desc: Monica is distraught after her break-up with Richard. Phoebe unsuccessfully tries to raise her spirits, but ultimately its Mr Geller who comforts his daughter. Elsewhere, Chandler and Janice begin seeing each other again and Joey cant stand it. The two plan a day of fun to try to overcome Joeys aversions for Chandlers sake. programme.sub-title: The One Where No Ones Ready

Meanwhile, Rachel tells Phoebe and Monica about Rosss Princess Leia fantasy.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where No Ones Ready
programme.desc: In a race against the clock, Ross tries to get the gang dressed and ready for a black-tie benefit at the museum.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica decides the best way to get over Richard is to keep herself busy. She develops a `jam plan, hoping the distraction of cooking will divert her attention. After making jars and jars of jam Monica decides she still wants to have a baby, so she begins searching for a sperm donor, and comes across Joeys file. Elsewhere, Phoebe is mistakenly stalked by a man who thinks shes Ursula, and Chandler receives dating advice.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Metaphorical Tunnel
programme.desc: Ross panics when he sees his son with a Barbie doll, and Chandlers fear of commitment surfaces in his relationship with Janice.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebes attempts to introduce her visiting half brother Frank Jr to the delights of city life leave him thinking that she works in a brothel. Meanwhile, Ross lists five famous women that he would like to date. To his surprise, actress Isabella Rossellini, one of the women he rejected while narrowing down his list, pops in to Central Perk.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: When Janice asks whether any of the friends have ever dated one another the gang has a flashback to three years ago (one year before the pilot was supposed to have happened) when everyones lives were beginning to come together. Phoebe moves out of Monicas apartment, Chandler searches for a new roommate - ending up with Joey, Monica bumps into Rachel, and Ross learns that Carol is a lesbian.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Race Car Bed
programme.desc: When Monica buys a new bed from the Mattress King, the wrong one is delivered. Meanwhile, Joey sees Janice kissing her husband, and Rachels father clashes with Ross.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Giant Poking Device
programme.desc: Chandler and Janice reach a turning point in their relationship, while Monica accidentally injures Ben and tries to hide it from Ross.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Airing from 2005 to 2009 on NBC, the game show series returns to primetime TV with original host Howie Mandel. A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash -- from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Fifth Gear

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs

programme.title: Gold Divers

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: More adventures on the high seas off the coast of Alaska with the Dutch Harbor fishing fleet.

programme.title: Maine Cabin Masters
programme.desc: The crew are tasked with a relocation and land manifestation of a family yurt. With a budget of $15,000, the pressure is on to complete it on time.

programme.title: Maine Cabin Masters
programme.desc: A couple and their five children want to turn their recently purchased camp into a family vacation home. They create a beautiful place for the family to enjoy.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The family join in with a competitive pheasant hunt in preparation for Thanksgiving. Then, Billy and Ami surprise the siblings with new additions to the homestead.

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: The team run into trouble whilst tracking a massive animal in the middle of the night. Russell hopes to find clues that explain the anomaly on his thermal scan.

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: After a potential new breakthrough, Josh returns to Guatemala, searching for a snake king tomb. Using new technology, he hopes to find the tombs location.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys struggle to revive an inherited Wyoming hill country homestead with a tragic legacy; to bring water to the property, Marty must solve the mystery of an untapped well; Misty and Matt combine forces on one of their most ambitious builds.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The mining season is almost over and Cols crew take one last gamble opal-spotting from the air. The Cooke brothers strive to save their mega opal machine and disastrous season.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies relationship is on the rocks as they battle their biggest claim yet as well as each other. With two partners working at different speeds, theres a fight brewing.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Fishing crews on the Bering Sea endure mortal peril and intense discomfort during crab season, with 12-metre waves, 318-kilogram crab pots that can easily crush a careless crewman, and freezing temperatures around the clock.

programme.title: Expedition X
programme.desc: A murderous monster is said to lurk in the vast swamplands near New Orleans. Phil and Jess investigate an ancient Cajun mystery surrounding a bloodthirsty werewolf-like beast terrorising the Bayou.

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Josh Gates joins leading archaeologists as they investigate Americas first missing-persons case, The Lost Colony of Roanoke. Following newly discovered clues, he digs for answers to this 400-year-old mystery.

programme.title: Marooned With Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adventurer Ed Stafford has walked the length of the Amazon River - he is the first person to accomplish that - and survived alone for 60 days on a desert island near Fiji (a feat chronicled in `Naked Castaway), so perhaps the challenges presented in `Marooned arent that daunting. Filmed in Venezuelas Gran Sabana mountains, Botswanas Okavango Delta, Romanias Carpathian Mountains, the Western Australia coast, and Borneos Brunei jungles, the five hourlong episodes see Stafford - a former British Army captain - attempt to last ten days in the harsh environments with nothing more than a camera. Viewers are provided a fly-on-the-wall perspective as Ed tries to find food, make fire, process water to drink, and build a shelter - among many other life-saving challenges.

programme.title: Naked and Afraid: Alone
programme.desc: All-star survivalist Ky struggles in the Amazon rainforest. He faces swarms of mosquitos, blood-thirsty piranhas and caiman-filled waters.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest delves into the island of Java in Indonesia, seeking the Javan tiger. It was declared extinct in 2003, but there have been recent reported sightings.

programme.desc: A family emergency forces Johnathan to make a desperate move on the Time Bandit.

programme.title: Maine Cabin Masters
programme.desc: A couple inherited their quaint cabin from his grandfather, who originally built the cabin by hand in 1978. Chase and his team focus on transforming the former fish and lobster shack into a fun family cabin.

programme.title: Maine Cabin Masters
programme.sub-title: Teaching an Old Cabin New Tricks
programme.desc: A family has created lasting memories of their cabin overlooking Harpswell Sound, but the cabin is in need of some work to see the next 20 years and beyond; Chase and the team expand it to accommodate the next generation.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Birdie goes on a treacherous hunt to bring home meat for the family and save her chickens from slaughter. Later, Noah constructs an automatic diaper machine.

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Russell uses an unlikely ally to pursue a strange predator. Meanwhile, Bryce investigates the teams recent encounters with some mysterious floating orbs. Plus, Ronny and Mireya use the technology to track down a creature in the woods.

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Josh has a fresh lead on a shipwreck from 1715 with a potentially massive treasure haul. He launches an expedition into Floridas Atlantic coast.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys meet their match on a homestead in Idaho, where millennial off-gridders are plagued with dead soil, grizzly bear visits and constant landslides. Making matters worse, COVID again strikes one of the Raneys, jeopardising the rescue.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justins second-hand excavator has an expensive oil leak. Plus, Cols crew are a man down and the Fire Crew are on a wild goose chase hunting a bounty of fabled fire opal.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: For the Rookies, theres tension as a new partner leads them on a wild goose chase underground. Plus, the Cooke Brothers season is off to a bad and dangerous start.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Sig pursues the invasive Russian king crab in Norway, and Jake mortgages his beloved Saga. Meanwhile, John chases after the golden kings, and Josh reunites with a lost Harris brother.

programme.desc: The guys make an attempt to track down a classic Nissan Patrol for surfer, Kerry. She hands over her daily motor, a VW Touran, which even breaks down when she is en route to the garage.

Filmed in Venezuelas Gran Sabana mountains, Botswanas Okavango Delta, Romanias Carpathian Mountains, the Western Australia coast, and Borneos Brunei jungles, the five hourlong episodes see Stafford - a former British Army captain - attempt to last ten days in the harsh environments with nothing more than a camera. programme.title: The Last King of Scotland
programme.desc: Idi Amin is the murderous Ugandan dictator of the late 70s and Dr Nicholas Garrigan is a young Scottish doctor. While travelling through Africa, Garrigan almost by chance becomes enlisted as Amins doctor and confidante. However, as Amin becomes more deranged, Garrigans close relationship with him endangers not just his own life but those around him.

programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: A star-crossed romance develops between an unhappily married princess and a Swedish nobleman.

programme.title: Storm Over the Nile
programme.desc: Adapted from the book `The Four Feathers, a tale of honour, redemption and derring-do set during the British Armys 1898 campaign in Sudan. Harry Faversham is a disgraced soldier who goes way beyond the call of duty to prove his courage.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: A luckless naval Lieutenant is duped into commanding a dangerous mission into enemy territory during the Bismarck Sea Battle, but his boat is barely shipshape, and his crew turns out to be a bunch of wise-cracking landlubbers.

programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: A band of Confederate soldiers capture a large consignment of Yankee gold, then go on the run with their haul when they realise that the war has ended. Although no longer threatened by the Yankees, they soon find themselves under attack from ruthless bandits determined to get their hands on the gold.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: Henry Brogan is an elite assassin who becomes the target of a mysterious operative who can seemingly predict his every move. To his horror, he soon learns that the man whos trying to kill him is a younger, faster, cloned version of himself.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: The CIA recruits a lawyer in order to negotiate the immediate release of a captured, and imprisoned U.S. pilot.

programme.title: Mean Streets
programme.desc: A graphic portrayal of life in the underworld of the Little Italy district in New York City. The episodic narrative deals with the experiences and relationships of a petty hoodlum, his epileptic lover and her unstable cousin who is on the run from a loan shark.

programme.title: The Double
programme.desc: An awkward office drone becomes increasingly unhinged after a charismatic and confident look-alike takes a job at his workplace and seduces the woman he desires.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go North
programme.desc: This week, the Hairy Bikers are in Yorkshire. The plan is simple - riding through the county to visit top food producers, who not only have amazing products but equally amazing stories to tell.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul looks back over his journey into the baking of the worlds cities, and showcases some moments spent with his shirt sleeves rolled up, baking with the bakers themselves.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood City Bakes
programme.desc: In New York, Paul discovers how doughnuts have been recreated with fresh, innovative flavours. He also meets Jim Lahey, an internet sensation for inventing a new way of baking bread at home thats so simple, Paul can hardly believe it works.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond puts a fresh spin on dinner with a one-pan Chicken Cauliflower Skillet, saucy Rustic Turkey Meatball Pasta and an extra-fast Orange Ginger Steak Stir-Fry. Plus, she cooks Grilled Pita Pizzas piled high with vegetables for a solo supper.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares how one delicious Perfect Paprika Pork Shoulder becomes three amazing, budget-friendly meals. First she makes White Beans with Pork and Croutons for lunch, followed by Sheet Pan Nachos and Pork Celebration Sandwiches.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Avocado Hollandaise and Speedy Sausage Pizza
programme.desc: Jamie rustles up his restaurant-quality avocado hollandaise and then he gets his son Buddy involved in cooking a different pizza for all the family to enjoy.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Chicken and Pepper Curry and Broccoli and Cheese Pierogi
programme.desc: Jamie demonstrates an easy traybake, chicken and pepper jalfrezi, where the oven does all the hard work. Then he shares his version of pierogi dumplings, stuffed with broccoli and cheese.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the penultimate round and as the travelling marquee pitches up in the Cornish village of Mousehole, its time for the bakers to get to grips with the most difficult of all baking skills - pastry. They bake their own versions of hearty British pies, get down to details with exquisite pastry canapes, and take a crash-course in crimping for this weeks surprise bake.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the Grand Final and the last three surviving contestants face their biggest challenge yet - baking for the Bake Offs Afternoon Tea Party. In order to be crowned the victor, they will need to bring together all of their skills, making cakes, bread and pastry.

programme.title: James Martins American Adventure
programme.desc: Welcome to Cowtown! James continues with a full-on cowboy onslaught around Fort Worth. Famous for its great open-range cattle drives of the late 19th century, James gets in the spirit and tries his hand at cattle roping with the famous Fort Worth Herd before cooking outside the cattle exchange.

programme.title: James Martins Favourite Feasts
programme.desc: James is joined by French chef Daniel Galmiche as they head for the outdoors for a shooting competition. Daniel makes coq au vin with James countering with beef wellington. Then, its pumpkin soup.

programme.title: James Martins Favourite Feasts
programme.desc: All aboard for a culinary cruise. A day trip on a fishing boat turns up some delicious surprises for James and friends with lobster and mackerel coming over the side.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul looks back over his journey into the baking of the worlds cities, and showcases some moments spent with his shirt sleeves rolled up, baking with the bakers themselves.

programme.title: Ravneet Gills Chop House
programme.desc: Aiming for the perfect lunch menu, Ravneet bakes Tottenham cake, discovers a mouthwatering chocolate tart, and Mattie makes glazed ham.

programme.title: Ravneet Gills Chop House
programme.desc: With the restaurant sign up, Mattie cooks his mums pasta, Ravneet makes trifle, and they source suppliers. But will her trifle pass the mum test?

programme.title: James Martins French Road Trip
programme.desc: James and the Hairy Bikers park up their trailer near the market at Pont Aven in Britanny, where they find fresh vegetables and plump local chicken.

programme.title: James Martins French Road Trip
programme.desc: James is back in Brittany where he first learnt about French food as a student, and hes joined by fellow chef Martin Blunos for a dawn raid on the fish and vegetable market in Vannes.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy has a caramel pecan roll in Idaho, has an English breakfast in California, meets some fans for burgers in Connecticut.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy has a bacon blue cheeseburger in Sacramento, a meatball sandwich in Indianapolis, and turtle soup in Pennsylvania.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a crepe joint in Colorado, a Jewish deli in New York, that serves kreplach and has lamb cheese steak in Washington.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a big seafood spot in New Orleans, a Jersey cheese steak joint in Indiana, and tries the fans favourites in Connecticut.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey Webbs tasty travels take him to Newport, RI. He checks out a coastal clam creation and a huge French toast platter in the crazy Go Bananas Challenge.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey Webbs food frenzy takes him to New Yorks Hudson Valley for a classic autumn, orchard-to-table treat, an Italian dessert for breakfast and wings so hot they have him seeing ghosts in the 4.5-pound Atomic Ghost Wings Challenge.

programme.title: Guys Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri brings back the winning teams of previous competitions for another battle of team supremacy.

programme.title: Paul Hollywood City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul visits the historic Sicilian capital of Palermo and discovers its rich street culture. He explores Arabic influenced food markets selling local specialities and learns the secret of making perfect, crispy and creamy cannoli.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond serves up a series of dinners in record time. She starts off with a Steak Frites Salad mash-up with speedy hollandaise and One Pot Cajun Alfredo. She whips up sensational shortcut Egg Roll Bowls and foolproof Jalapeno Pineapple Pizza.

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares inspirational ideas for impressive dinner parties. She prepares Seared Strip Steak with Jalapeño Cream Sauce, one pan Garlic Butter Shrimp Penne, stunning Lighter Braised Greens and make-ahead Tiramisu Cheesecake Cups.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Spiced Cauliflower Rice and Cajun Salmon Po Boy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up a show-stopping spiced cauliflower rice pie recipe as well as sharing his take on how to elevate the simple salmon fillet with his delicious Cajun-spiced po boy.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Stuffed Roast Peppers; Chicken Noodle Soup
programme.desc: Jamie shows his stuffed peppers, served on a punchy black bean stew, with avocado and feta cheese, then serves up a hearty bowl of spicy chicken noodle soup, packed full of vegetables.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve of the countrys best amateur bakers take part in the second series of `The Great British Bake Off. In the first round, the bakers are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours and the stress soon shows. Next, they face a technical challenge - featuring a coffee and walnut Battenburg cake from one of Mary Berrys recipes - and finally, they have to make and bake a tiered showstopper cake.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the second round and eleven bakers remain. This time their pastry skills are scrutinized as the bakers tackle tarts. Over two days the bakers will face three increasingly complicated challenges whilst trying to avoid a soggy bottom. Judged by acclaimed master baker Paul Hollywood and legendary cookery writer and baker Mary Berry.

programme.title: James Martins American Adventure
programme.desc: James Martins American Adventure reaches Dallas and a trip to Southfork, the ranch made famous in the world-renowned TV series `Dallas. James gets a tour before cooking in the grounds of the ranch. Once in the heart of the city, James goes to the Texas State Fair and gets a peek at the preparations happening for the huge annual event.

programme.title: James Martins Favourite Feasts
programme.desc: Chef James Martin creates a menu harking back to his childhood. He serves a crayfish cocktail, roast leg of lamb with vegetables and mint sauce, with a vodka and vanilla blancmange for dessert.

programme.title: James Martins Favourite Feasts
programme.desc: James Martin prepares some lovely winter dishes in his own kitchen that will warm the cockles of your heart. How about a warming pea and ham soup followed by a grand old English delicacy - he turns a pigs head into brawn. Leave room for your afters - apple pie with a vanilla custard.

programme.sub-title: Stuffed Roast Peppers; Chicken Noodle Soup
programme.desc: Jamie shows his stuffed peppers, served on a punchy black bean stew, with avocado and feta cheese, then serves up a hearty bowl of spicy chicken noodle soup, packed full of vegetables.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Twelve of the countrys best amateur bakers take part in the second series of `The Great British Bake Off. In the first round, the bakers are challenged to make 24 decorated cupcakes in two hours and the stress soon shows. Next, they face a technical challenge - featuring a coffee and walnut Battenburg cake from one of Mary Berrys recipes - and finally, they have to make and bake a tiered showstopper cake.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its the second round and eleven bakers remain. This time their pastry skills are scrutinized as the bakers tackle tarts. Over two days the bakers will face three increasingly complicated challenges whilst trying to avoid a soggy bottom. Judged by acclaimed master baker Paul Hollywood and legendary cookery writer and baker Mary Berry.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Simple Suppers
programme.desc: Whether it is sweet and sour, hot and cold or spicy and cool, the right flavour combinations can create great results. Many people dont have time to follow cookery books and Nigels unflustered style makes the dishes easy to remember without complicated recipes. He also visits local allotment holders and creates a tasty feast from the fruits of their labours.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Simple Suppers
programme.desc: As the nights draw in, food writer Nigel Slater makes the kind of food that can really brighten up dark rainy evenings. Nigel creates a weeks worth of delicious meals that are simple to make. Nigel raids his cupboards, fridge and veg patch to make comfort food that hits the spot and makes staying in a real treat.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: Featuring pasties, fresh mackerel, pigeon and peas and clotted cream, all products of his beloved Cornwall.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: This edition includes happy pigs from the Isle of Wight, real cider from Somerset, peppery watercress from Hampshire streams, and Thomas Hardys favourite cheese.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guys pulling up to some longtime favourites. In Williston Park, New York, the 1920s candy and ice cream place thats added mozzarella sticks and rigatoni to an old school fountain menu. In Sonoma, California, a spot in a historic downtown building doing a lamb burger with an African twist and scratch made borscht.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a dog-friendly joint in Indianapolis, an old jambalaya spot in New Orleans, and a wood fired pizza place in California.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a Cajun joint for smoked tasso, a Napoletana pizza place in San Antonio, Texas, and a Greek diner in Denver, Colorado.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Americas most interesting and unique restaurants. In Minneapolis, Guy visits a deli for Eastern European sausage and in Kansas, a spot that marinates steak in red wine and cola.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb journeys across America to tackle daunting food challenges and sample iconic regional dishes. Enormous food options create problems for even the most voracious of eaters.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Casey Webb journeys across America to tackle daunting food challenges and sample iconic regional dishes. Enormous food options create problems for even the most voracious of eaters.

programme.title: Guys Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy Fieri brings together four all-star chefs to test their burger-making prowess. In one round, they must make an over-the-top burger and fries combo.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight

programme.desc: Patrick Christys explore tomorrows news, tonight, including all the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad.

programme.title: Breakfast with Stephen and Ellie
programme.desc: Start your day with all the news and views from Britains best Breakfast show.

programme.title: Britains Newsroom
programme.desc: When the news happens, it happens here. But what does it mean for you? Every weekday morning, Britains Newsroom brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from the across the UK.

programme.title: Good Afternoon Britain
programme.desc: Every weekday from midday, we bring you the news as it breaks. Wherever its happening, well have it covered - as well as giving our own view and how it matters to you with Tom and Emily.

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan is in the heart of the English countryside at Warwick Castle. While it appears idyllic today, for centuries it was a poisoned chalice to the Earls of Warwick who lived there and its walls echo with tales of betrayal, bloodshed and murder.

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tonys walk takes him back to 1940 when the sleepy county of Dorset became the frontline in the war against Hitler. His five-day, 60-mile walk along the Jurassic coast reveals the countys hidden World War II story. Starting by the defences on Chesil Beach, Tonys journey encompasses stunning scenery and amazing acts of ingenuity and bravery as he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes for a walk through some of Britains beautiful and historic landscapes. Tony kicks off the series with a 40-mile walk through the glorious Peak District, along the Derwent Valley, where the worlds industrial revolution was born. This is a journey that reveals how Britain transformed itself from a nation of farmers into the industrial powerhouse of the world.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: In York, Professor Alice Roberts takes part in a Viking battle, meets the metal detectorists behind one of the UKs greatest archaeological finds, and gets her hands on Viking poo.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice tells the story of Norman England by studying the history of Winchester, Britains most Norman city. Alice attempts to storm a castle in chain mail, investigates the origins of modern surgery and tucks in to an appetising eel pie.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Skeletons tell of both violent death and tenderness at the royal seat of power in Bamburgh, Northumbria, while at a remarkable community project at a shopping centre in Sittingbourne, people curate the grave goods of their own ancestors.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In the final episode Dr Alice Roberts goes in search of the Tudor age, a time that saw momentous changes across all aspects of British life. Along the way Alice visits excavations at Shakespeares first theatre in Londons Shoreditch, where the Bard began his career and `Romeo and Juliet was first performed. Alice also joins a team sifting through Shakespeares rubbish at his last home in Stratford-Upon-Avon.

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Situated high on a crag overlooking the river Forth, Stirling Castle has guarded the gateway to the Scottish Highlands for centuries. The residence of kings, armies and felons, its battle-scarred walls have witnessed savagery and chivalry, intrigue, alchemy, adultery and murder. Location filming, stunning aerial shots and reconstructions bring to to life its turbulent history.

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A flat in Pegswood in Northumberland, a terrace in Swadlincote in Derbyshire and a former shop in Chatham in Kent are given makeovers.

programme.desc: Lucy meets a young couple expecting a baby who have to weigh up whether to live in their auction buy in Sydenham in London while Martin talks to a man and his father in law who have bought their first property together in Trentham near Stoke and Dion meets a man who only went into property development after he retired. programme.desc: By the late 1980s, the news in Northern Ireland is a daily list of the dead. But 14 bloody days in March 1988 mark a new level of harrowing savagery. When a car reverses at speed into an IRA funeral cortege, mourners are convinced its another attack, a repeat of a grenade and gun strike by a lone loyalist that had killed three at an IRA funeral just days earlier. The car contains two British soldiers who are lynched and shot dead by a baying mob.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.sub-title: From Berneray to Pabbay: The Riddle of the Sands
programme.desc: Paul Murton continues his island odyssey, exploring the remote and fascinating places which scatter our coastline, and meeting the people who call these islands home. On this Grand Tour, Paul is exploring a cluster of islands in the Outer Hebrides. Lying just off the North Uist coast is princely Berneray, where his journey begins. From there he heads south to capture the colours of Grimsay, and then weaves through the marram grass of Kirkibost, to end on the deserted whisky island of Pabbay.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters

Theres a cast iron mangle for woodworker Bruce Faulseit, and upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell sets to work trying to give a much cherished chair a second chance. Sarah has a metal bed frame to repurpose, but will she succeed in finding new homes for the three items?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Its the fourth leg of Margie Cooper and Tim Medhursts jaunt about the country in a big blue 1970s camper van. This time, silver expert Margie and auctioneer Tim are off to the seaside, starting their trip from Blackpool.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Tim splashes a three-figure sum on an old childrens toy. Margie, meanwhile, spies a bulldog gong, convinced this rare piece of Victoriana will attract bids for higher than the price she paid.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Auctioneer Angus Ashworth and his team are called out to peoples homes with a mission to sift through a lifetime of possessions and find forgotten treasures that can be sold at auction.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Embarking on the fourth leg of their road trip, James Braxton and Irita Marriott rummage through antiques shops across Wiltshire and Dorset. James goes on a journey back to the land before time where he meets a famous fossil hunter. Irita takes a break from shopping to visit the site of the once-great Shaftesbury Abbey.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and James Braxton cruise Britains back roads in a 1960s motor as they search for profitable antiques to sell at auction. Irita gives James a run for his money as the duo head into the final leg of their trip.

programme.title: Yorkshire Air 999

programme.desc: The air ambulance team battles to save a woman trapped in her car after a 40mph crash. Plus, a pensioner is hurt after crashing her car into the side of a house.

programme.desc: The team are called in to investigate a house in Nottingham. The owners believe the house is haunted by multiple spirits, both malevolent and protective.

programme.title: R.I.P.D.
programme.desc: Members of an odd police force chase monstrous spirits who try to escape their final judgment by hiding among the living. When the lawmen uncover a plot that could end all life, they must restore the cosmic balance.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Madame Web
programme.desc: After showing signs of clairvoyance, New York City paramedic Cassandra Webb must confront revelations about her past and protect three young women from a mysterious adversary who wants them dead.

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Oscar-winning World War II tale combining the story of an unusual rescue mission with an overwhelmingly powerful re-creation of the D-Day landings. A group of American soldiers are dispatched to locate one man among thousands, a US private whose three brothers have all been killed in action. The powers that be want to send him home to his family.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: Though the Nazis fail to open the gates of Hell, one little devil gets through. Raised at a secret FBI lab, Hellboy is a cigar-chomping, crimson demon with a breezeblock for a right hand and a gift for fighting otherworldly beasts. Lively action fantasy based on the cult comic book.

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: The eponymous commando is coaxed out of retirement to act as a guide to a group of aid workers on a humanitarian mission in Burma. However, when the Burmese army captures the group, he mounts a violent one-man rescue mission to try to save the missionaries.

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: A group set out on safari into the heart of the Congo. Each have their different reasons for the trip, but nothing could have prepared them for the greatest danger - a troop of intelligent killer apes.

programme.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
programme.desc: Johnny Blaze gets a chance to rid himself of the Ghost Rider curse forever when members of a secret church hire him to save a boy from Satan.

programme.title: Money Train
programme.desc: A pair of transit policemen decide to raid a New York subway train loaded with money. Foster brothers John and Charlie have held a lifelong fantasy of robbing the networks money train, which collects millions of dollars each night from the citys subway stations. In addition to trying to deceive their boss, the boys must also contend with a beautiful new decoy cop.

programme.title: Tom and Jerry: Cowboy Up!

programme.title: Curious George
